remarks: If we have a right angle, then the mirror point is the point inversion.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 15-Dec-2019.)
statement:
ismid.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
ismid.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
ismid.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
ismid.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
ismid.1 $e |- ( ph -> G TarskiGDim>= 2 ) $.
lmif.m $e |- M = ( ( lInvG ` G ) ` D ) $.
lmif.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
lmif.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. ran L ) $.
lmicl.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
lmimid.s $e |- S = ( ( pInvG ` G ) ` B ) $.
lmimid.r $e |- ( ph -> <" A B C "> e. ( raG ` G ) ) $.
lmimid.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. D ) $.
lmimid.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. D ) $.
lmimid.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
lmimid.d $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
lmimid $p |- ( ph -> ( M ` C ) = ( S ` C ) ) $.
